member.name: M:Arx.Insight.Entities.BaseRecord.LazyLoad``1(System.Func{System.Int32,``0},System.Int32,``0@)
member.summary: Returns the value of . If it's null, is called first.
member.remarks: Contains a hack to not call if the is 0 and create a new instance of instead. This fixes a bug where all new items of a type will share child objects because they retrieve the same list when their is 0. On the bright side, there is also a performance improvement as it eliminates a needless call to the data access service for new items with 0 which always returns nothing.
member.param: Function to load the item(s) by ID
The ID to be supplied for the func.
The item field.
member.typeparam: Type of item to lazy load
member.returns: The final value.

member.summary: A termination type has not been assigned, likely due to an error.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.RingTimeOut
member.summary: The call was not answered within the configured amount of time.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.UserRelease
member.summary: The agent released the call before the third party.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.ThirdPartyRelease
member.summary: The third party released the call before the agent.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.Abandoned
member.summary: A party ended the call before it was answered.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.HoldAbandoned
member.summary: The call was disconnected while it was on hold.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.TransferOut
member.summary: The call ended due to being transferred.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.ConferenceOut
member.summary: The call ended due to being conferenced.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.UserDeflected
member.summary: The call has been deflected by the user.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.CallRecord.CallTerminationType.ThirdPartyDeflected
member.summary: The call has been deflected by the third party.

member.summary: The call has been placed manually via handset or API request.

member.summary: An inbound call.

member.summary: The call is between local extensions.

member.summary: The call is part of a preview dialing campaign.

member.summary: The call is part of a power dialing campaign.

member.summary: The call is part of a predictive dialing campaign.

member.summary: The call is part of a precise dialing campaign.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time zone entity.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.CtiProviderClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the CTI provider class.
member.remarks: The format of this value must be: namespace.class, assembly The CTI provider assembly must be deployed to the program folder of the ARx Insight CTI Tray agent.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.EnablePhoneVerification
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not phone extension verification should be enabled.
member.remarks: If enabled the ARx Insight CTI Tray Agent will prompt the user to dial their own extension on the telephone they are connecting with to ensure that the user is connecting to the telephone they are stationed at. NOTE: Not all CTI Providers support verification.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.PhoneVerificationTimeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in seconds to wait for phone extension verification.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.RestrictMaxRingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not a maximum ring time should be enforced by the CTI provider.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.MaxRingTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time the CTI provider will allow an outgoing telephone call to ring before automatically disconnecting the call.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.LocalCallingProfile
member.summary: Gets the local calling profile entity.

member.name: P:Arx.Insight.Entities.CtiConfiguration.Parameters
member.summary: Gets a collection of parameters for this configuration.
member.remarks: Refer to your specific CTI provider documentation for a list of the required configuration parameters.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile
member.summary: Defines a compliance profile
member.remarks: Compliance profiles are used to determine which rules, messages, and dispositions apply to which clients in an account management system.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.EnforcementModes
member.summary: The enforcement mode enumeration

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.EnforcementModes.MostRestrictive
member.summary: All addresses and phone numbers will be considered and any failing rules will result in a validation request being not ok to call.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.EnforcementModes.PrimaryAddressOnly
member.summary: Only the primary address will be considered when evaluating which regions (and therefore rules and messages) will apply to this account.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.EnforcementModes.RequestedPhoneOnly
member.summary: Only the currently requested phone number will be considered when evaluating which regions (and therefore rules and messages) will apply to this account.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.EnforcementModes.RestrictiveOnAddressOrRequestedPhone
member.summary: The primary address and requested phone number will be considered when evaluating which regions (and therefore rules and messages) will apply to this account.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.ComplianceLoggingModes
member.summary: The compliance logging modes.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.ComplianceLoggingModes.Disable
member.summary: Do not log compliance validation results.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.ComplianceLoggingModes.RejectedCalls
member.summary: Log compliance validation results only when the call is rejected by the engine.

member.name: F:Arx.Insight.Entities.ComplianceProfile.ComplianceLoggingModes.AllCalls
member.summary: Log all compliance validation results.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.DispositionInSystem
member.summary: Maps a disposition code from an external system to an ARx Insight call disposition.
member.remarks: Disposition mappings are used when migrating call logs from a system like an automated dialer to objects in the ARx Insight system. This may be required when a system is in use that prevents the ARx Insight CTI Tray Agent to monitor certain calls.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the that is associated with this record.
member.remarks: This external system will log it's own call records with it's own disposition codes.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.ExternalSystem
member.summary: Defines a system that tracks calls or accounts.
member.remarks: ARx Insight is designed to bridge several software systems such as account management systems / CRMs, automated dialer systems, phone call logging systems and phone call recording systems. While the ARx Insight CTI Tray Agent and APIs allow for calls to be tracked against agents and accounts, the external system plug-ins allow for additional details to be retrieved from other systems.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.LocalCallingProfile
member.summary: Represents a local calling profile.
member.remarks: A local calling profile can be used to assist the ARx Insight CTI Tray Agent in determining whether or not a telephone number needs to be dialed as long distance. Some telephony providers or systems may handle long distance dialing on their own and therefore do not require a local calling profile to be configured.

member.name: T:Arx.Insight.Entities.PhoneEventLogControl
member.summary: Defines a phone event log control entry.
member.remarks: Phone event log control determines whether or not detailed logging is enabled for a phone extension. The ARx Insight CTI Tray Agent will check the phone event log control every few minutes to determine whether or not phone events should be logged. There is no need to restart an ARx Insight CTI Try Agent to enable logging.
